Articles.Content:
I'm presenting my new addon series. Most of the parts and packs will use PowerTech.dll (for sources and officially published part module specifications see the plugin thread), however there will be also demo-compatible versions (if it's possible)

PowerTech.dll v0.2.6

compiled for KSP 0.15.2. KSP 0.16 compatibility approved. Compatibility not guaranteed for other versions

PowerSat

Description: automated communications satellite with multiple advanced features:

Currently implemented:

*Deploying and rotating solar panels (and they have their collider meshes).

*The satellite changes its vessel name to 'PowerSat %mother craft name%' instead of '%mother craft name% Debris'

*Attitude control (gyroscopic) - the satellite points to the ground

*Solar panel orientation - the satellite uses roll control and panel rotation to turn the solar panels to the Sun.

*PowerSat recognized as comsat in The_Duck's Satellite Relay Network.

*Attitude control during timewarp and automatic attitude adjustment when loading already deployed satellite.

*The satellite can be deployed and undeployed by right-click menu.

Planned:

*Other attitude control modes: other celestial body or some absolute direction (for telescopes and interplanetary relay satellites)

*Orbit correction engine

*Control panel

*Orbit correction autopilot

*Special control panels and autopilot programs for stationary/synchronous orbits

Full version: http://www./?193xi5q00po6g4j

Requirements: KSP 0.14 or higher, PowerTech.dll v0.1 or higher

Demo compatibility: none

http://youtu.be/MQUyJp8j2vo

http://youtu.be/HQVG3hPMQlY

Instructions:

Get it to the orbit, activate it and fly a bit away from it. It will deploy the panels and the antenna, then the attitude control will activate.

Zoxygene recharge panels - PowerTech edition

The module combines panel features of Zoxygen and PowerTech as well as adds some new features.

To be used with Zoxygene addon (v0.5+)

Once deployed, the panels turn themselves to the Sun and produce Zoxygen depending on attitude.

Warning: high drag coefficient and low durability. Do not deploy in the atmosphere!

Full version: http://www./?vtcenpt4c5w2965

Requirements: KSP 0.14 or higher, PowerTech.dll v0.2.3 or higher, Zoxygene v0.5 -0.5.2.

Demo compatibility: none

Credits: Original model by l00 (Zoxygene). Edited and adapted by Alchemist.

Instructions:

Activate the panels and ensure their rotation axis doesn\'t points to the Sun.

Soyuz solar panels (animated by PowerTech)

Animated Soyuz solar panels.

The solar panels from Xemit's Noyuz pack animated by PowerTech. These panels are deployable but do not rotate.

Full version: http://www./?sxkicfwxv47ob2j

Requirements: KSP 0.14 or higher, PowerTech.dll v0.2.2 or higher.

Demo compatibility: Demo-compatible (not fully animated) version in Noyuz pack

Credits: Original model by Xemit (Noyuz). Adapted by Alchemist.

Instructions: just place on your craft. These panes are based on solar panels used on Soyuz crafts (most versions, both old and new) and on Salyut 1 station.

If you want the panels to be down-faced, just change rightRotate = 1 to rightRotate = -1 in part.cfg

Edited August 4, 2012 by Alchemist

Works perfectly! I\'ll be excited to see what\'s next!

- Kayla

ItÂ´s really cool!! 8) 8)

It makes a lot of fun!
